image.altText: A police officer in uniform with a serious expression standing in front of a police logo

props.synopsis: Police say the alleged offenders had the wrong address and that the 18-year-old victim, who was shot in the leg, was not the intended target.

title.children: Six people arrested for attempted murder after allegedly shooting at 'wrong address'

image.altText: Police car with officer and leafy street with houses in background.

props.synopsis: Police have responded to reports of a shooting incident in Adelaide's north-east.

title.children: Man taken to hospital after allegedly being shot in leg

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The state and federal governments today announced they will dedicate a combined $30 million to the Whyalla airport, in addition to $3.14 million from the federal government to kick start the long-awaited foreshore development.

title.children: Major cash injection for Whyalla foreshore development and airport

image.altText: A koala looks down from the fork of a gum tree

props.synopsis: A sanctuary for up to 1,000 koalas and other wildlife is to be established on Kangaroo Island with the hope it will bring tourism and education opportunities while protecting the valuable population of marsupials.

title.children: New koala sanctuary plan for Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Adam Reilly - man with white shirt and Indigenous artwork tie looks ahead

props.synopsis: Adam Reilly has told a parliamentary inquiry it was not his decision to leave the Department for Child Protection and has called for changes to the system.

title.children: 'Hurtful rumours': Former SA child protection chief explains departure

props.synopsis: The final investigation into allegations of interference in First Nations artwork has concluded, with the Indigenous corporation regulator saying no further action will be taken.

title.children: Investigation into 'white hands on black art' allegations concludes

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas announcing a cabinet reshuffle.

props.synopsis: A new artificial intelligence portfolio and changes to the Child Protection Minister's responsibilities have been revealed in a reshuffle of the Malinauskas government cabinet.

title.children: AI, autism and child protection in focus for Malinauskas cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A teenage girl who had items of extremist material on her phone and school-issued laptop is just a "young, naive, Muslim girl with autism", a court has heard.

title.children: Muslim girl 'with autism' pleads guilty to possessing extremist material

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two young Victorian men who were involved in the attempted importation of more than 100 kilograms of cocaine into South Australia have been sentenced to three years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months.

title.children: Pair labelled 'muppets' jailed over attempted 'astronomical' cocaine import

image.altText: Steve Alderson photo

props.synopsis: Golfer Steven Alderson made international headlines when he became the first winner with autism on the Golf for the Disabled Tour. He hopes to use his success to inspire others living with autism to chase their dreams.

title.children: Bullied golf champion Steve Alderson hopes to become a beacon for others living with autism

image.altText: Young woman with her hair pulled back into a ponytail, wearing glasses, looks into the camera with serious expression.

props.synopsis: Workers say they feel "sad and hopeless" after being indefinitely stood down due to the virus, which can slash crop yields by up to 70 per cent.

title.children: Destructive tomato virus leads to 120 job losses at Victorian farm

image.altText: Man with head torch stands over a large flower

props.synopsis: Hand-pollination of the pungent corpse flower results in hundreds of seeds that will be sent across the world to help preserve the endangered species.

title.children: Adelaide corpse flowers spread endangered stench worldwide

image.altText: Dr Megan Brooks - woman with black jacket and blue shirt and short hair walks out of coroners court

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that multiple attempts to escalate an emergency response were made after a ramping-related death in Adelaide, but staff were told the situation did not meet the criteria.

title.children: Hospital boss's attempt to escalate emergency response after ramping-related death denied, court hears

image.altText: Shark carcass lies on the sand along the beach

props.synopsis: Research confirms a great white shark that washed up on a beach in south-west Victoria was the victim of killer whale predation.

title.children: Bite mark swabs show orcas killed 4.7m great white shark

image.altText: A group including members of the National Socialist Network.

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader refuses to sign his bail forms while 14 men were granted bail after their involvement in a far-right rally on the weekend.

title.children: Neo-Nazi refuses to sign bail forms as 14 others from Australia Day rally released

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Virgin has confirmed it will "indefinitely suspend" its Darwin to Adelaide service, saying it will add more direct flights between the Top End and other capital cities.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': Virgin suspends flights between Darwin and Adelaide

image.altText: Big black cockie with white marking on tail, perched on gum tree branch, holding a feather

props.synopsis: The deadly Wangary bushfire 20 years ago appears to have been the final nail in the coffin for yellow-tailed black cockatoos in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula. Ecologists are calling for urgent action before it's too late.

title.children: Help needed to save the last cockatoos restricted to this region

image.altText: Asian-looking smiling man, light suit, and woman, short hair, dark suit, tie, earrings, sit in front of  haystack, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Julie Mar says she has sometimes gone without buying groceries to fund her husband's partner visa. A solicitor says the application process can cost upwards of $9,000.

title.children: Partner visa expense and delay cause heartache for married couple

image.altText: Three women walk down a stair case, each with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A young woman who was at risk of death after her parents starved her as a teenager makes an emotional appeal to a Perth judge to spare them further punishment.

title.children: Woman starved by parents as a teenager blames herself, court told

image.altText: Female Israeli soldier Agam Berger holds a note whilst she is released from Hamas custody

props.synopsis: Hamas hands over Israeli soldier Agam Berger as another prisoner exchange begins in northern Gaza's Jabalia area.

title.children: Israeli soldier Agam Berger among prisoners released in hostage swap

image.altText: sir chan in tie

props.synopsis: The last of Papua New Guinea's founding fathers and one of the country's longest serving politicians, Sir Julius Chan, has died.

title.children: Founding father and 'icon' of Papua New Guinea Sir Julius Chan dies at 85

image.altText: Matthew Kuhnemann celebrates a wicket with teammates

props.synopsis: Australia breaks a team record for a Test match played in Asia before finally deciding to have a crack at Sri Lanka's batters. Follow live.

title.children: Australia strikes early after breaking team record against Sri Lanka

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: GOT HIM! Dimuth Karunaratne nicks off to Mitchell Starc
Kuhnemann has Oshada Fernando in the second over!
Australia declares on 6-654, stranding Alex Carey on 46*

image.altText: Alana King looks happy

props.synopsis: Australia bowls England out for 170 on the first day of a historic day-night Test at the MCG and makes a steady start with the bat as its Women's Ashes dominance continues.

title.children: Australia in box seat in Women's Ashes Test after rolling England on day one

image.altText: Anthony Albanese exists a car in Perth.

props.synopsis: Labor is acutely aware of which headlines will hinder or help as we head into an election campaign while new polling reveals which electorates will be most vulnerable to change on polling day.

title.children: Albanese's staff nearly broke the cardinal rule of campaigning

image.altText: Relative of stampede victim cries on the floor near ambulance.

props.synopsis: Surveillance cameras were meant to alert staff if crowds posed a safety threat, suggesting the government was providing premium facilities at the world's largest gathering of Hindus, but the fatal stampede "proved that was all a lie," say onlookers.

title.children: Celebration becomes tragedy in aftermath of Kumbh Mela stampede

image.altText: Noah Balta of Richmond warms up preapring to collect a bouncing ball

props.synopsis: Suspended Richmond star Noah Balta admits an assault following an incident that left a man in hospital with a head injury.

title.children: Richmond star to be sentenced over border assault

image.altText: Four people in black blazer jackets walking from train underpass

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old is the second person to be charged over the alleged murder of a 25-year-old man in the NSW Illawarra region.

title.children: Teenage boy charged with murder over man's death outside train station

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The girl's then-employer has pleaded guilty to charges relating to sexual relationships she engaged in with her and two other separate victims.

title.children: Teenage girl groomed by employer tells court her 'innocence' was taken

image.altText: A red haze of the fire in a paddock near a mountain range emitting billows of smoke

props.synopsis: A Country Fire Authority captain says his main concern is if bushfires burning at the northern and southern ends of the Grampians meet up.

title.children: Fire chief fears Grampians blazes could join to create 'massive' front

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Jawoyn Contracting 4

props.synopsis: Prominent Katherine Indigenous construction business Jawoyn Contracting has "ceased trading", leaving about 30 workers redundant.

title.children: NT Indigenous business' collapse leaves locals 'gutted', projects uncertain

image.altText: Ben Yole holds bridle of a horse.

props.synopsis: Leading Tasmanian harness racing trainer Ben Yole has had his racing licence disqualified for three years for the mistreatment of horses on his property at Sidmouth, near Launceston.

title.children: Leading harness trainer suspended over 'systemic' horse mistreatment

image.altText: A herd of black cows in front of green trees.

props.synopsis: A Wheatbelt family is offering a $20,000 reward for information after eight young cows were deliberately killed on their property near Gingin.

title.children: Farming family traumatised by shooting and torture of their cattle

image.altText: A graphic of a tram at a coastal location.

props.synopsis: The final stage of the Gold Coast's multi-billion dollar light rail line could end up being serviced by "rapid transit buses".

title.children: Last stage of Gold Coast light rail project could be replaced by buses

image.altText: A map of Australia shows several shaded patches indicating possible cyclones forming around Queensland and northern WA

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting multiple cyclones could form across northern Australia by the end of the week, as tropical lows linger off the coast of north Queensland, in the Gulf of Carperntaria, and off the Kimberley in Western Australia.

title.children: Four potential cyclones forecast for Australia over coming days, BOM warns
